oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Crayon print of Union veteran Thomas McCoy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. McCoy served in Co. G, 2nd East Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA, enlisting in January 1862 in Somerset (Ky." He was captured in Morgan County, Tenn. In March 1862 and accused of "bridge burning." McCoy was imprisoned in Richmond (Va.) and was paroled at City; Point (Va.) in March 1863. He was discharged from service in Knoxville (Tenn.) in August 1864. His brother William was in the same unit and was captured at Rogersville. William died in prison at Andersonville (Ga.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: McCoy, Thomas
